result.execSummary:
The defendant LONG XIONG was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts immediately after court. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 10:03 AM  Defendant LONG XIONG in court.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer in court for LONG XIONG.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement entered into court record.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with. Parties waive right to Pre-Sentence Investigation Report.

ADDRESS INFO for LONG XIONG
Current: 1731 1/2 N. Erb Street, Appleton, WI 54911 United States  (Effective: 08-11-2022)
Prior: 29 NEWBERRY CT, APPLETON, WI 54915

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant LONG XIONG in court.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer in court for LONG XIONG. Information on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court confirms Defendant's address and is updated on court record.  Court orders bond to continue.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed.  Defendant bound over for trial.

09:08 AM Defendant LONG XIONG in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer discussed on the record.   The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  Bond continues.  Record closed @  Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
